Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2010 06:55AM georgie_girl wrote: Hi again bestauntie - I also had a partial hysterectomy 4 years ago, when I was 34. No children. I am seeing my doc again later this week (finally made that appt)  You are right - trying to keep these things secret is not easy. The little bit of worry is always there.  I did confide with a colleague who was diagnosed a couple of years ago.  Her support has been great.  I have been getting sharp, stabbing, burning pain in my right nipple.  Probably hormonal - or caffeine!  But its awfully uncomfortable.  Don't even want to wear a bra at the moment.  Anyhooo...please let us know what happens tomorrow...
Posts.Title: Positive Mammo but negative ultra sound? bestauntie bestauntie

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2010 01:40AM - edited Jul 30, 2010 01:41AM by georgie_girl Hi bestauntie I felt the same!  Mammo showed minor calcifications and lumps, Ultrasound showed the small lump they were "looking" at.  Seemed like the mammo showed one thing and the US showed others...it was confusing for me, but nobody offered any explanation. The radiologist said that my GP will probably send me for an ultrasound, "but talk to your doctor".  That's it - he walked out.  Have not been for the biopsy yet.   With my personal and family histories, I am scared too.  But right now I try not to think about it too much.  Personal and work issues causing a lot of stress for me right now, so I am trying to stay as calm as I possibly can. Here's hoping your biopsy will be b9 too!  All the best.
Posts.Title: Positive Mammo but negative ultra sound? bestauntie bestauntie

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2010 09:37AM georgie_girl wrote: Hi mabeln I also have the same problems...But recent Mammo and U/S didn't show up anything "suspicious" apart from a "6 - month follow-up U/S for the next 2 years"...Thing is, my left breast is now bigger than the right one and also feels swollen...expecially in one particular section (lower outer quadrant).  Sensitive to touch and sore. I have since read a lot...interviewed BC survivors...vented my frustrations here!  I got some great advice and support.  The best advice I can give you, is take responsibility for your own well-being and peace of mind.  Make an appointment with your medical practitioner as soos as you can.  You have a right to be informed. Take care!
Posts.Title: please help mabeln hopeful34

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2010 07:17AM georgie_girl wrote: Thanks for the replies everyone...From now on this will be the first website I open when I log on!  I promise to keep you all updated on whatever happens - and even if I am perfectly fine and no malignancy ever occurs, I will still be here to lend my support to everyone else.  I am only discovering now how "sharing" helps - I'm a bit of an oyster! @Alligans : I had a partial hysterectomy 4 years ago - I was bleeding like a leaking faucet for about a year, non-stop.  One day I passed-out at work (almost falling down a flight of stairs) and long story short, my gynae recommended it - After I went for 3 different opinions (own GP, friend who is a dr and another gynae) they all agreed it would be for the best.  So, I don't get period anymore.  I still have an ovary, so I reckon I ovulate.  (pimple on my chin every month to confirm!) What is slightly worrying for me now, is that I used to have the breast pain for 3 to 4 days, but since last month its still around...sometimes so bad I don't want to fasten my seatbelt - and I NEVER drive without fastening my seatbelt.  I think I have health anxiety too...I don't handle / deal with pain very well. So thanks for sharing your concerns with me - I really do appreciate your advice and yes, actually the radiologist did say that my GP would in all likelihood recommend a biopsy - but he did not put that in his report and I reckon that's why my GP did not suggest one...
Posts.Title: STUPID! georgie_girl wyldblumusic

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2010 07:40AM georgie_girl wrote: @ artsci1 : You know what?  I am a bit of a funny girl too!  Sometimes I must admit I let the anxiety get to me, but the one thing I have going for me is that I can laugh at myself at the best (and worse) of times!  LOL!  you checking and re-checking your films is what I'm doing at the moment! I should probably stop that... I am very sorry, I will have to correct myself - (brain running at 180km/h) my GP did not say he does not "believe" in mammograms, but that he does not believe in mammo's for younger women, and definitely not annual ones.  He suggested I read up on that on the net - A new study in the US that said annual mammo's are not a good idea, or something.  I could not find the website he suggested - perhaps its only for the medical profession?  And he did say he most certainly does not recommend an annual mammo for me, no matter what the radiologist said. (He did not look at the mammo cd himself, just handed it over to me without opening it) I have very good medical insurance...But now I am starting to think what they tell people who cannot afford it (in SA its very expensive) and state hospitals are sometimes a worse nightmare than any illness...And because most people cannot afford private radiologists a mammo and U/S can amount to what a lot of people in SA earn per month...Goodness, I am a worrier! And you know what?  I DO pray...I am one of those people who pray everyday for everyone and everything and sometimes just to say thank you that I AM well...and even when I don't feel so well, I still say thanks that I'm still alive - because there are a lot of people who depend on me and care about me.  So thanks for that girl -  We all need reminders now and again!
Posts.Title: STUPID! georgie_girl wyldblumusic

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2010 07:55AM georgie_girl wrote: @ wyldblumusic - Firstly, I love that screen name -  I wish I'd thought of that!  Thanks for the suggestion - I will make work of that as soon as I can.  I live in a small (growing) city by the sea (hence my screen name!) and we only have 3 gynae's.  And they're booked 6 months in advance...  I will let you know what I can manage then... And thanks for the warm wishes -  As I look out my window, I think I can still see some snow on the mountain tops, so I can do with all the warmth I can find!
